newsitem.title: CHINA: China's southwest to boost coffee output.
newsitem.headline: China's southwest to boost coffee output.

text.p: China's southwestern Yunnan province plans to spend 340 million yuan over the next five years to expand coffee output, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.
Under the plan, the province will initially establish a 5,000-hectare coffee farm and a coffee processing plant with an annual output of 5,000 tonnes, Xinhua said.
Southwestern Yunnan has 40,000 hectares of land suitable for growing coffee and its arabica compares well with that of Colombia and Kenya, Xinhua said.
The province already grows coffee on 3,300 hectares and has annual output of 2,000 tonnes, Xinhua said.
Acreage will be expanded by 16,000 hectares in the next 15 years, it said.

In 1988, Yunnan received $1.16 million worth of donations to boost technology for coffee output in accordance with an agreement with the United Nations Development Programme and with equipment from Germany and Italy, the province is now exporting to the United States, Britain, Japan and Australia.
